data.title: Tech Tuesday: Top custom app development platforms for SMEs
data.author: Yajush Gupta

heading.text: Why insurers should be all about the data

paragraphs.text: Credit: Luca Bravo
Yajush Gupta
September 17, 2024

As small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) increasingly seek affordable and efficient ways to build tailored applications, several platforms have emerged as go-to solutions for custom app development.

These platforms offer a range of no-code and low-code tools, enabling businesses to create apps without extensive technical expertise or high development costs.  Here are three standout platforms making waves in the SME sector:

The JFrog Platform bridges the gap between DevOps and DevSecOps processes for SMEs, offering a customised hybrid solution that scales to meet their needs. As app developmentbecomes mainstream, extending into edge and IoT devices, having a single, end-to-end platform like JFrog’s is essential for securely automating the delivery of trusted software releases.

The platform also provides unrivalled control over binaries from code to production in software development, redefining automation in DevOps, DevSecOps, and MLOps. This ensures businesses can develop software faster and more securely. JFrog enhances developer productivity, drives strategic business savings, and simplifies governance and compliance, offering full auditability and traceability across the software development lifecycle (SDLC).  By accelerating software release cycles and maintaining budget efficiency, JFrog sets new standards in the software industry, empowering SMEs to innovate confidently and compete effectively in today’s rapidly evolving market.

Wippli, the flexible no-code platform, is set to launch its next major milestone, Wippli Neura, in Q2 2025. This update will introduce a ground-breaking white-labelled marketplace, enabling partners to create, commercialise, and share bespoke workflow solutions.

The platform’s new USP is to leverage its two-sided marketplace approach, empowering users to monetise their expertise by creating and selling custom workflows and digital products. This democratisation of software development disrupts traditional models, offering SMEs unprecedented access to tailored, intelligent business solutions. Enhancing its core strengths in decision intelligence, Wippli Neura advances the concept of AI agency, where artificial and human intelligence collaborate seamlessly.

This progress marks a shift from Large Language Models (LLMs) towards Large Action Models (LAMs), propelling businesses towards more autonomous operations. “Wippli Neura isn’t just about expanding our workflow automation capabilities,” says CEO Jay Marcano. “It’s about revolutionising how businesses approach problem-solving and decision-making. We’re creating a world where humans will be able to create, nurture and monetise their AI professional version of themselves.”
Best for: Web apps and MVPs

Bubble is a no-code platform designed for building web applications with ease. With its intuitive drag-and-drop interface, even non-developers can create fully functional apps. The platform also features built-in workflows and a rich plugin library to streamline the development process. SMEs can customize UI/UX designs to suit their specific needs, making Bubble a popular choice for developing cost-effective, scalable apps. By removing the need for traditional coding, Bubble empowers smaller businesses to launch web applications quickly and affordably.
Best for: Mobile and web apps

AppGyver is another no-code platform that caters to both web and mobile app development. Offering a visual interface, the platform simplifies the process of building apps for iOS, Android, and the web. With pre-built logic flows and integration options for REST APIs and databases, AppGyver allows SMEs to create robust apps that fit seamlessly into their existing operations. AppGyver’s free tier and powerful capabilities make it a standout choice for smaller enterprises looking to build sophisticated mobile apps without breaking the bank.

Best for: Business process automation and internal apps
Zoho Creator is a low-code platform ideal for businesses aiming to automate processes and develop internal apps. With its drag-and-drop design tools and seamless integration with Zoho’s suite of business software, the platform offers flexibility and power. Advanced features like workflows, form creation, and AI-powered functionalities enable SMEs to create custom solutions tailored to their business needs. Zoho Creator allows SMEs to automate and streamline their operations, reducing manual tasks and increasing efficiency.
Keep up to date with our stories on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and Instagram.
Yajush Gupta
Yajush is a journalist at Dynamic Business. He previously worked with Reuters as a business correspondent and holds a postgrad degree in print journalism.
